Modules¶

Main Module¶

Classes¶

Person¶

class main.Person(name, age, email)¶

Bases: object

Represents a person with a name, age, and email address.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the person.

  • age (int) – The age of the person.

  • email (str) – The email address of the person.

Raises:

AssertionError – If age is negative or email is invalid.

static deserialize(data)¶

Deserializes a JSON string to a Person object.

Parameters:

data (str) – The JSON string to deserialize.

Returns:

A Person object.

Return type:

Person

Raises:

AssertionError – If age is negative or email is invalid.

get_email()¶

Gets the email address of the person.

Returns:

The email address.

Return type:

str

introduce()¶

Prints an introduction message.

serialize()¶

Serializes the Person object to a JSON string.

Returns:

The JSON string representation of the Person.

Return type:

str

Student¶

class main.Student(name, age, email, student_id, registered_courses=[])¶

Bases: Person

Represents a student, inheriting from Person.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the student.

  • age (int) – The age of the student.

  • email (str) – The email address of the student.

  • student_id (str) – The ID of the student.

  • registered_courses (list) – A list of registered course IDs.

static deserialize(data)¶

Deserializes a JSON string to a Student object.

Parameters:

data (str) – The JSON string to deserialize.

Returns:

A Student object.

Return type:

Student

register_course(course_id)¶

Registers the student for a course.

Parameters:

course_id (str) – The ID of the course to register.

Instructor¶

class main.Instructor(name, age, email, instructor_id, assigned_courses)¶

Bases: Person

Represents an instructor, inheriting from Person.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the instructor.

  • age (int) – The age of the instructor.

  • email (str) – The email address of the instructor.

  • instructor_id (str) – The ID of the instructor.

  • assigned_courses (list) – A list of assigned course IDs.

assign_course(course_id)¶

Assigns a course to the instructor.

Parameters:

course_id (str) – The ID of the course to assign.

static deserialize(data)¶

Parameters:

data (str) – The JSON string to deserialize.

Returns:

An Instructor object.

Instructor

Course¶

class main.Course(course_id, course_name, instructor, enrolled_students)¶

Bases: object

Represents a course.

Parameters:

  • course_id (str) – The ID of the course.

  • course_name (str) – The name of the course.

  • instructor (Instructor) – The instructor of the course.

  • enrolled_students (list) – A list of enrolled student IDs.

add_student(student_id)¶

Adds a student to the course.

Parameters:

student_id (str) – The ID of the student to add.

DatabaseManager¶

class main.DatabaseManager(database)¶

Bases: object

Manages database operations for students, instructors, courses, and registrations.

Parameters:

database (str) – The database file name.

backup(filename)¶

Creates a backup of the database.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The backup file name.

close()¶

Closes the database connection.

create_course(course_name, instructor_id)¶

Creates a new course in the database.

Parameters:

  • course_name (str) – The name of the course.

  • instructor_id (int) – The ID of the instructor teaching the course.

create_instructor(name, age, email)¶

Creates a new instructor in the database.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the instructor.

  • age (int) – The age of the instructor.

  • email (str) – The email address of the instructor.

create_registration(student_id, course_id)¶

Registers a student for a course.

Parameters:

  • student_id (int) – The ID of the student.

  • course_id (int) – The ID of the course.

create_student(name, age, email)¶

Creates a new student in the database.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the student.

  • age (int) – The age of the student.

  • email (str) – The email address of the student.

delete_course(course_id)¶

Deletes a course from the database.

Parameters:

course_id (int) – The ID of the course to delete.

delete_instructor(instructor_id)¶

Deletes an instructor from the database.

Parameters:

instructor_id (int) – The ID of the instructor to delete.

delete_registration(student_id, course_id)¶

Deletes a registration.

Parameters:

  • student_id (int) – The student ID.

  • course_id (int) – The course ID.

delete_student(student_id)¶

Deletes a student from the database.

Parameters:

student_id (int) – The ID of the student to delete.

Returns:

A list of course records.

A list of student records.

restore(filename)¶

Restores the database from a backup file.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The backup file name.

update_course(course_id, course_name, instructor_id)¶

Updates a course’s information.

Parameters:

  • course_id (int) – The ID of the course to update.

  • course_name (str) – The new course name.

  • instructor_id (int) – The new instructor ID.

update_instructor(instructor_id, name, age, email)¶

Updates an instructor’s information.

Parameters:

  • instructor_id (int) – The ID of the instructor to update.

  • name (str) – The new name.

  • age (int) – The new age.

  • email (str) – The new email address.

update_registration(student_id, course_id)¶

Updates a registration.

Parameters:

  • student_id (int) – The student ID.

  • course_id (int) – The course ID.

update_student(student_id, name, age, email)¶

Updates a student’s information.

Parameters:

  • student_id (int) – The ID of the student to update.

  • name (str) – The new name.

  • age (int) – The new age.

  • email (str) – The new email address.

Functions¶

main.update_data()¶

Updates the data by saving students, instructors, and courses to ‘data.json’.

main.load_data()¶

Loads data from ‘data.json’ and deserializes it into students, instructors, and courses.

main.update_row()¶

Updates a row in the GUI table. Functionality to be implemented.

main.delete_row()¶

Deletes a row from the GUI table. Functionality to be implemented.
